intro: [WRONG START] Gunningiopsis quadrifida, commonly known as the four-lobed flax, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive four-lobed leaves. The plant produces showy blue or violet flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
